title: Ocean Week Characters.
body:
Now i'm all fine with Character diversification and what not.

But why the hell did you make Ashe and Sejuani into black people?

Like in what realm does that actually make sense?

You could have just as easily put Karma/Lucian into the image, or something similar if you wanted the diversity.

replies.body:
They're supposed to be ordinary OCE players personified as their main champions.

That's why Braum has a tie. He's an office worker IRL, but in-game he becomes his main champion Braum. Or Sejuani is a black teenager IRL, but in-game he becomes Sejuani and his pet hamster becomes Bristle.

Essentially it makes sense because people main all kinds of champions, not just those of the same race as them.

Just like how Fizz is a human (and a girl), that Braum is as skinny as a twig in comparison to his in-game design, or that Sejuani's boar is a wombat-ish marsupial or just a hamster. And I don't know who the girl on the far right is supposed to be, is she Poppy or Taric? Either way, she clearly isn't of the same species or sex as the characters. Not to mention, if you look closely, none of them are wearing body-wears belonging to the champs beyond their icons (Ashe's bow and arrow for instance).

They are not supposed to represent the champions themselves, but the players who fancy them. Think of them as cosplayers if you will. As long as you identify with a character in cosplay, anything goes, who cares.

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/bigbangtheory/images/4/4f/The_Middle_Earth_Paradigm.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130115220507
